description: From Latin abaliēnātus, perfect passive participle of abaliēnō (“alienate; remove”); from ab- (“by, from; away”) + aliēnō (“alienate, estrange”); from aliēnus (“foreign, alien”), from alius (“other, another”). Equivalent to ab- +‎ alienate.

verbs.description: abalienate (third-person singular simple present abalienates, present participle abalienating, simple past and past participle abalienated)

entries.meaning: (civil law, transitive) To transfer the title of from one to another; to alienate.
(obsolete) To estrange; to cause alienation of.
